meanings.definition: A person who is a member of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated partan always attends our meetings.
meanings.sent2: She became a partan of the club last month.
meanings.sent3: The partan brought cookies to the group gathering.
meanings.sent4: As a loyal partan, he stood by his team through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: Being a partan means being part of a team and working together.

meanings.sent1: Can you partan the cake into equal slices?
meanings.sent2: She likes to partan her tasks to manage her time effectively.
meanings.sent3: He tried to partan the puzzle but got confused.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to partan the land with its winding path.
meanings.sent5: The chef will partan the ingredients before cooking.

meanings.definition: A portion or section of something.
meanings.sent1: Please pass me a partan of the pizza.
meanings.sent2: The book is divided into several partans for easy reading.
meanings.sent3: The partan of the movie where the hero saves the day is my favorite.
meanings.sent4: Each partan of the project will be assigned to a different team member.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained each partan of the lesson clearly.

meanings.definition: To take part in an activity or event.
meanings.sent1: She will partan in the dance competition next week.
meanings.sent2: He loves to partan in community events.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to partan in the chase after the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The students eagerly partan in the science fair every year.
meanings.sent5: It's important to partan in discussions to share your ideas.
